alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 06 at 1:04AM MST until February 08 at 3:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM MST TUESDAY... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 35 to 55 mph, with gusts up to 70 mph, are expected. Isolated wind gusts approaching 90 mph are possible along the immediate eastern slopes of the Rocky Mountain Front. For the High Wind Watch, west winds 35 to 45 mph, with gusts up to 70 mph, are possible. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front and adjacent foothills and plains. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 2 PM this afternoon to 10 AM MST Tuesday. For the High Wind Watch, from Tuesday evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Westerly wind gusts will fall to between 45 and 55 mph from late Tuesday morning through early Tuesday evening before increasing once again Tuesday night through Wednesday afternoon.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
